intro: Hesperis matronalis f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered honesty, is a cultivar of the common honesty plant. It is characterized by its pale white petals that contrast with its green foliage, making it a striking addition to gardens. This plant belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental species. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, rounded seed pods that split open to release seeds. The flowers bloom in early summer, adding a delicate touch of white to the garden landscape.
